6.19.23  3:47 am   favorite potato chip flavor?

      hostile brand acquisition

6.19.23  3:19 am   do you ever listen to film soundtracks?

      i listen to the soundtrack (score) of a film, in the film (not separately). however, sometimes 'film soundtrack' means something else: a music album of songs that are either partially featured in the film, or just otherwise associated with the film. those types of albums, no, i do not listen to. although perhaps i may listen to songs that happen to be on such an album

6.19.23  2:49 am   Would you rather be a sweet corncob or a bitter parsnip?

      i would rather have more options

      no

     yes

      i would add a link here if asked, and if it was already on another section of the site

      same as the P in "Alex P. Keaton", or the J in "Michael J. Fox". it stands for "style"

6.18.23  2:52 pm   what rhymes with orange

      clothes pin

6.18.23  11:36 am   In a recent question you brought up how music recommendation is sensitive. I think I have a general idea what you meant by this, but could you elaborate a bit more? Thanks:)

      i mentioned that in response to what the question said. the question said something about when your dad tries to convince you to pay attention to jimi hendrix. and my feeling was that that's a good example of when a music recommendation comes on a little too strong. a better time for music recommendation might be if you are already sharing a lot of music with the person, and you've already established some commonalities between your tastes, and/or the receiving person has already expressed an interest in receiving recommendations at that particular time. Unsolicited recommendations, however, mostly will not be effective, even if the product is good

6.18.23  11:12 am   If animals could talk, which species do you think would complain the most?

      human

6.18.23  10:03 am   Is being interviewed the way you are on this page very different from when you're a guest in a talk show or podcast?

      yes

6.18.23  8:13 am   what do you think of the possibility that you might hold views relating to the status quo?

      never heard of it

      they just looked so good together on screen, i had to write something for them

      no. the distorted viewing experience they're having is a sufficient punishment

6.17.23  8:44 pm   what do you feel about songs that shift in tempo a lot

      that happens a lot less often now in the age of computers. probably because it's more difficult to accomplish within the computer. in that sense, it's probably worth exploring, because it's still just as good as it ever was, and would probably seem more fresh now because it's less common

6.17.23  8:38 pm   Is green a creative color?

     it might be

     If not, why?

      maybe it was too predictable. for example: if you see a traffic light, and the bottom light is green, that is not creative. that's just what it's expected to be

      pretty good

     you can try, but you won't find out whether you succeeded, until after it's released

     i want drums but like chill drums not a heavy backbeat. how do you write your chill drum grooves?

     it's like choosing what clothes to wear. no one knows how to do it. if you figure it out then you'll be the first one

     and while i'm at it, how do i make a piano playing one chord per bar a bit more interesting, without going crazy? 

     the answer to that may be different in every song

      it's your name

      because it's just familiar enough to mean something, but just rare enough to feel fresh. dazzle your friends

6.16.23  11:14 pm   I've been thinking about how much something's/someone's reputation affects people's perception... Like, are the songs in the "Real Book" great, timeless pieces of music and therefore were chosen to be in the book for that reason, or have the songs become standards BECAUSE they were put into the Real Book?

     there are different types of songs in there. a large percentage of them were already standards for a long time before they were in the book. These are things like 1930s songs with lyrics, many of which were featured in theatrical musicals, and were very popular. There's also a totally different, fairly small category of music in that book, which are songs that were trendy amongst the players who compiled the book at that time. many of those ones are probably not-so-classic, and certainly are not standards. but, regardless, there are plenty of tunes in the book that just, for one reason or another, just usually aren't good, or they aren't good when played from the book. so these are the ones people don't like to play. they turn to the page and say "hmm, let's try this one" and then it's like "eich, no that one sucks" and they don't do it. but then there are some that just shine like the sun, even through the paper. so naturally those ones are the good ones. And very often, the ones that were big hits long before the book, are damn great in the book also, even without the lyrics. what tends to make something a 'standard' is if it endures popularity for many many years. Generally if you look at the songs played at weddings, or in the pubs, you will get a more updated idea of what today's "standards" are

     If the Real Book was never published, would a whole new set of songs have become "the standards"?

     over all, in my opinion, the Real Book has had very little influence on what songs have endured popularity among listeners and players

      Or what if Shakespeare never published any work when he was alive, and nobody ever heard of him until someone in the 21st century just happened to digup some chest in some old crypt that had all of Shakespeare's writings... would 21st century critics still be like "OK, this guy is the greatest playwright and greatest English writer of all time... we must make high school and college students study his work"?

     it would struggle against a 400-year language barrier. even though he was spicy fresh with the language, there is no longer a population of native speakers of the language base he was starting from. if he were born in the modern day, he'd surely do it damn great, starting from our language as we know it today and then pushing it forward from there

     Or if Jimi Hendrix wasn't on every magazine/internet list as the "Greatest Guitarist of All Time", would as manyguitarists still think of him as being so great?

     if someone "assumes he is probably great", i don't count that. the exposure helps, but in a way it's a curse because some people probably feel pressured to like him so they never can give him a good genuine first-hand listen

     I remember my dad playing me Hendrix when I was a kid and saying something like "Hey, listen closely, this guy's the best."

     yeah, that's a real buzz-kill for music. music recommendation is extremely sensitive, and it can backfire easily

      All our lives, I feel that we are explicitly told by schools, articles, magazines, parents, etc. "This artist is great because blah blah blah... that artist is a genius because blah blah blah..."

     yeah whatever, that's clickbait, don't worry about that. in time you'll figure out what really floats your actual boat

      You know those little memory-eraser things fromthe Men In Black movies? I wonder if the whole world had their memory erased, but all the music, art, literature, etc. still remained... would peoplestill gravitate towards what is today considered "great"?

     no one's true feelings about anything would change. fake feelings however, would be what gets the re-set

      Sorry, I don't know what my question is exactly ... just ramblin on over here.

6.16.23  8:43 pm   So this https://billwurtz.com/la-de-da-chorus.jpg was the beginnings of La de da de da da de day oh?

      that was when the title/chorus first came up. but the verse is actually based on something i'd written earler (at the lower date, which is also incorrect, it's supposed to say 09 not 08)

      it seems best to be predictable for some of the time but not all the time

6.16.23  2:38 pm   I feel like most your songs are predominately in major keys. I know this is a very generic (probably too generic) way of phrasing it, but do you have a preference for major keys over minor keys? Also, would you say that major keys 'feel' different than minor keys? 

      well typically the first thing we all notice about major keys compared to minor keys is that major keys seem "happy" and minor keys seem generally "sad." And what happens to me whenever i put myself in a minor key, within a fairly short amount of time it tends to launch itself into a major key somehow

      i'm not sure if anyone's ever done that before

      sure
